job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Lewiston, ME
pros: Easy to get to know professors, and in general, there is a large variety of research topics available for a given field.
cons: Can't think of any, personally.

pros: Through recessions (2008) and most recently COVID, Bates actively chose to not have layoffs or furloughs. This is a theme for Bates - it values and looks to care for employees.
cons: Small endowment, tuition dependent. There's a culture of "why can't we do what X or Y college does" when those colleges have 3 to 5 times our endowment, and the employees who promote that culture seem to sit out the financial town-halls that explain how are resources are constrained by the marketplace and tuition pressure. Also, as with all institutions, there are departments that aren't as good to work for as others. Avoid those, and Bates is fantastic.

job_title: General Research Assistant in Lewiston, ME
pros: You can get paid as a student, professors/employers are generally accommodating when you have lots going on outside of the research position
cons: I can't think of any cons :)

pros: Parking permit, bigger room, a decent paycheck for walking around money and an opportunity to grow as a person. By serving the Bates community you will learn a lot about yourself and how you handle different situations. It will also a job: it gives you responsibilities beyond grades and sports.
cons: If your personality doesn't mesh with it, you won't have a good time. Do it for the right reasons and because you would be an asset - not because you want a good room. Your bosses can quickly see who is half-assing it for the perks and who is doing their job.

job_title: Art Walk Head Coordinator in Lewiston, ME
pros: The environment was definitely a place were one felt welcomed even if they were a little conservative.  All in all the place definitely runs a like a non-profit.  I really enjoyed my time here.
cons: There is no option for potential employment after graduation.  It seems like it is a place that barely gets by because it barely does get by, unfortunately.  I would recommend it as a learning experience but nothing else.

review_title: The atmosphere at Bates College is one of positive personal achievement.
job_title: Assistant Field Hockey and Basketball Coach in Lewiston, ME
pros: There are many resources and connections at Bates College if one wants or needs to use them. The campus feels friendly and welcoming the moment you step on its grounds, and the staff from the grounds keepers to the professors exude the same...
cons: One of the down sides of working at Bates College is finding housing on or near the campus.  Finding full-time employment can be difficult as well for more recent college graduates.

pros: Bates is a good environment to work in with good benefits and decent pay if you have been there a number of years.
cons: Starting pay for non salaried employees is low making it difficult to hire full time employees with desired qualifications.

pros: great faculty, small class sizes, personal connection with peers and professors. Good dining hall.Lots of opportunities to learn and try new things, many resources.
cons: Remote location in Lewiston Maine, the endowment of the college is small compared to similar schools. The gym is old and the machines do not always work.

job_title: Associate Director, Development in Lewiston, ME
pros: Bates has a terrific wellness program that provides free head/neck massages to employees a few times a year, and also provides easy access to CSAs in both the summer and the winter (with rebates for early subscribers).
cons: Finding parking can be a challenge, and with no parking garage(s), you're guaranteed to do a lot of snow removal off your car in the winter.

job_title: Database Reporting Specialist in Lewiston, ME
pros: The benefits are great and the landscaping is pretty nice.  lots of vacation and extra days off. lots of opportunity to enjoy extra community activities.
cons:
it's amateur hour all the time!
Food in the cafeteria is cheap but of substandard quality.
you going to be bored, and working with 10+ years out of date technology

pros: There are none other than it is one of the few employers in the Lewiston Auburn area. This however leads into one of the biggest cons, because Bates can treat employees very poorly knowing employees have few other options.
cons:
Horrendous pay.
No opportunity for advancement.
An aging IT infrastructure which cannot handle the demands placed on it. 
Overbearing management.
Low endowment means staffing levels are not adequate to meet the needs of the College, so existing employees get asked to do more, with no gain in wages.

review_title: Excellent employer who treats people with respect.
pros: Bates was built on sound principals of education for all, all are equal. These principals guide the administration.  It is an incredibly collaborative place to work.  Your voice will be heard.
cons: Because it is so collaborative, it sometimes takes a while to get a decision you need to move forward.

pros: Working as a student intern at the office of intercultural education was such a great experience and provided insight on the politics of race and culture on the entire campus
cons: I think it is pretty ridiculous that they still haven't found a well-qualified director for the Multicultural (oops now intercultural) center! Get it together, Bates!

pros:
It is a great place to work! The work was very motivating and I loved every minute of it. Would recommend it to anyone who wants a work life balance. 
Students were great too!
cons: Location of the work place is quite rural. Work can be manual sometimes

pros: I had a wonderful experience working as a teaching assistant in the economics department. The hours were flexible, the students are motivated, and the staff are great.
cons: I do not have any as of now. My experience was great and I would suggest working at Bates to anyone.

pros: Everyone is very friendly. My boss is encouraging and patient. The students are welcoming and always say hello!
